page.title: 07Barnston, Lt Dunmow, Felsted
page.content:
The villages of Barnston, Little Dunmow and Felsted each have their own Parish Council dealing with local affairs such as footpaths, street lighting, village halls, etc. This Council is elected from local people by local people and the normal term of office is three years.
The wider issues of the villages such as planning, roads, etc., are controlled and administrated by the Uttlesford District Council, which in its self is a division of Essex County Council.
The area forms part of the rural parliamentary constituency of Saffron Walden and is represented by a Conservative M.P., Mr. Alan Haselhurst.
